name: ListEstimates
description:
Retrieve a list of all estimates with pagination.

Use this tool to fetch all estimates, including pagination information, from Zoho Books.

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: Specifies the ID of the organization to filter the estimates.

value_schema.description: ID of the organization

parameters.name: estimate_number_filter
parameters.description: Specify an estimate number or use variants like 'startswith' or 'contains' for partial matching to filter estimates.

value_schema.description: Filter or search estimates by their unique estimate number. Supports variants such as estimate_number_startswith and estimate_number_contains for partial matches. Useful for quickly locating a specific estimate or a group of estimates with similar numbering.

parameters.name: reference_number_filter
parameters.description: Filter or search estimates by their reference number. Supports partial matches using 'startswith' and 'contains'.

value_schema.description: Filter or search estimates by their reference number. Supports variants such as reference_number_startswith and reference_number_contains for partial matches. Useful for linking estimates to external systems, customer requests, or internal workflows.

parameters.name: customer_name
parameters.description: Search estimates by customer's name with optional variants for partial matches, such as 'startswith' and 'contains'.

value_schema.description: Filter or search estimates by the customer’s name. Supports variants such as customer_name_startswith and customer_name_contains for partial matches. Useful for quickly locating all estimates associated with a specific customer or group of customers with similar names.

parameters.name: total_filter
parameters.description: Specify a condition to search estimates by their total amount. Use variants like 'less_than', 'less_equals', 'greater_than', and 'greater_equals' for range queries.

value_schema.description: Filter or search estimates by the total amount of the estimate. Supports variants such as total_less_than, total_less_equals, total_greater_than, and total_greater_equals for range-based queries. Useful for finding estimates within a specific budget or identifying high-value quotes.

parameters.name: filter_by_customer_id
parameters.description: Filter or search estimates using the unique customer ID. Use the `customer_id` provided by the Contacts API for the same organization to retrieve estimates linked to a specific customer.

value_schema.description: Filter or search estimates by the unique customer ID. Use the customer_id returned by the Contacts API for the same organization. This helps you retrieve all estimates linked to a specific customer.

parameters.name: filter_by_item_id
parameters.description: Filter or search estimates by the unique item ID. Use the item_id returned by the Items API for the same organization to find estimates including a specific product or service.

value_schema.description: Filter or search estimates by the unique item ID. Use the item_id returned by the Items API for the same organization. This allows you to find all estimates that include a specific product or service.

parameters.name: item_name_filter
parameters.description: Search estimates by item name. Supports variants like 'item_name_startswith' and 'item_name_contains' for partial matches.

value_schema.description: Search estimates by item name.Variants item_name_startswith and item_name_contains

parameters.name: search_by_item_description
parameters.description: Search estimates by item description. Use variants 'item_description_startswith' and 'item_description_contains' for pattern matching.

value_schema.description: Search estimates by item description.Variantsitem_description_startswith and item_description_contains

parameters.name: search_by_custom_field
parameters.description: Search estimates by a custom field, supporting variants like 'startswith' or 'contains' for partial matches. Useful for identifying estimates linked to specific custom data.

value_schema.description: Search estimates by custom field.Variantscustom_field_startswith and custom_field_contains

parameters.name: expiry_date
parameters.description: Specify the expiration date of the estimates to filter the results. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD.

value_schema.description: The date of expiration of the estimates

parameters.name: estimate_date_filter
parameters.description: Search estimates by date using variants like 'date_start', 'date_end', 'date_before', or 'date_after'.

value_schema.description: Search estimates by estimate date.Variants date_start, date_end, date_before and date_after

parameters.name: estimate_status_filter
parameters.description: Filter estimates by status. Allowed values: draft, sent, invoiced, accepted, declined, expired.

value_schema.description: Search estimates by status.Allowed Valuesdraft, sent, invoiced , accepted, declined and expired

parameters.name: filter_estimates_by_status
parameters.description: Specify the status to filter estimates. Allowed values: Status.All, Status.Sent, Status.Draft, Status.Invoiced, Status.Accepted, Status.Declined, Status.Expired.

value_schema.description: Filter estimates by status.Allowed Values Status.All, Status.Sent, Status.Draft, Status.Invoiced, Status.Accepted, Status.Declined and Status.Expired

parameters.name: keyword_search
parameters.description: Keyword search across estimate number, reference number, or customer name to quickly find matching estimates.

value_schema.description: Perform a keyword search across estimate number, reference number, or customer name. Use this parameter to quickly find estimates that match any of these fields, making it easier to locate relevant records with minimal input.

parameters.name: sort_estimates_by_column
parameters.description: Specify the column to sort estimates by. Options: customer_name, estimate_number, date, total, created_time.

value_schema.description: Sort estimates. Allowed Values customer_name, estimate_number, date, total and created_time

parameters.name: deal_potential_id
parameters.description: Potential ID of a Deal in CRM. Use this to filter estimates linked to specific deals.

value_schema.description: Potential ID of a Deal in CRM.

parameters.name: page_number
parameters.description: Specify the page number to fetch. Default is 1.

value_schema.description: Page number to be fetched. Default value is 1.

parameters.name: records_per_page
parameters.description: Number of records to fetch per page. Default is 200.

value_schema.description: Number of records to be fetched per page. Default value is 200.
